summary: "Crazy Rich Asians" is a 2018 romantic comedy-drama film directed by Jon M. Chu, based on Kevin Kwan's novel. It stars Constance Wu and Henry Golding. The story follows Rachel, an American professor who discovers her boyfriend Nick's family is incredibly wealthy in Singapore. Filming took place in Singapore, Malaysia, and New York. The movie was praised for its mostly Chinese cast, but also criticized for not representing Singapore's diverse races and for casting biracial actors. It premiered in August 2018 and was a big hit, earning over $238 million. It received many awards nominations, including Golden Globes and Screen Actors Guild Awards. Two sequels are being made.
title: Crazy Rich Asians (film)
